OOG.content: “the Absolute of the Idea as the Telos of an infinite determinability is the Absolute of intentional historicity”
OOG.linkedContent: “the Absolute of the Idea as the Telos of an infinite determinability is the Absolute of intentional historicity”

OOG.content: this “of” is neither objective nor subjective genitive > announces the Absolute of genitivity, the pure possibility of genetic relations, primordial interdependence of subject/object
OOG.linkedContent: this “of” is neither objective nor subjective genitive > announces the Absolute of genitivity, the pure possibility of genetic relations, primordial interdependence of subject/object

H.content: question of foreigner: foreigner is in question, also, foreigner, putting the first question, puts me in question
H.linkedContent: question of foreigner: foreigner is in question, also, foreigner, putting the first question, puts me in question

MPM.content: when de Man quotes Mallarmé’s “this shallow calumniated stream called death” from “Tomb of Verlaine” (signatory of epitaph always writes on his own tomb), Derrida tells us genealogy of genitives cannot be broken by cenotaph or cremation: the tomb of Verlaine of Mallarmé of Paul de Man
MPM.linkedContent: when de Man quotes Mallarmé’s “this shallow calumniated stream called death” from “Tomb of Verlaine” (signatory of epitaph always writes on his own tomb), Derrida tells us genealogy of genitives cannot be broken by cenotaph or cremation: the tomb of Verlaine of Mallarmé of Paul de Man

VM.content: in classical infinitism (Descartes) neutralization of space to liberate positive infinity, body: exteriority, zero point, origin of space, an origin which has no meaning w/out of, origin inseparable from genitivity, from space it engenders/orients, an inscribed origin, written, traced
VM.linkedContent: in classical infinitism (Descartes) neutralization of space to liberate positive infinity, body: exteriority, zero point, origin of space, an origin which has no meaning w/out of, origin inseparable from genitivity, from space it engenders/orients, an inscribed origin, written, traced

S.content: furnace (embrasement) of spirit (affects, affects itself, and gets affected by fire)

OH.content: culture of other: signals culture never has a single origin
OH.linkedContent: culture of other: signals culture never has a single origin

WM.content: metaphor always carries its death w/in itself, this death is always the death of philosophy [but the genitive is double]
WM.linkedContent: metaphor always carries its death w/in itself, this death is always the death of philosophy [but the genitive is double]

REST.content: once there is ghost (fantôme) or double as revenant, logic of identification is not easily appeased > ghost of Van Gogh: genitive translates the malaise, Unheimlichkeit, all by itself

PIO.content: “invention of the other” neither subjective nor objective, deconstruction as invention deconstructs this double genitive

EJQB.content: double genitive (question of God) is embedding of ontological & grammatical w/in graphein

AD.content: yes, yes: the welcoming of the other (l’accueil de l’autre) (objective/subjective genitive)

WOG.content: deconstruction at work in the ‘origin,’ already from the ‘origin’ itself—upon deconstruction of the origin
